AStar

Class AStar

  • java.lang.Object
    • AStar.AStar

  • public class AStar
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses the A* Algorithm to find the shortest path from an initial to a goal node.Nodes have to implement the ISearchNode and IGoalNode interface respectively.
    Author:
    Jonas David Nick

    • Method Detail

      • shortestPath

        public java.util.ArrayList<ISearchNode> shortestPath(ISearchNode initialNode,
                                            IGoalNode goalNode)
        Returns the shortest Path from a start node to an end node according to the A* heuristics (h must not overestimate). initialNode and last found node included.

      • search

        public ISearchNode search(ISearchNode initialNode,
                 IGoalNode goalNode)
        Parameters:
        initialNode - start of the search
        goalNode - end of the search
        Returns:
        goal node from which you can reconstruct the path

      • min

        public ISearchNode min(java.util.ArrayList<ISearchNode> queue)

      • path

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ISearchNode> path(ISearchNode node)
        returns path from the earliest ancestor to the node in the argument if the parents are set via AStar search, it will return the path found. This is the shortest shortes path, if the heurstic h does not overestimate the true remaining costs
        Parameters:
        node - node from which the parents are to be found. Parents of the node should have been properly set in preprocessing (f.e. AStar.search)
        Returns:
        path to the node in the argument

      • numSearchSteps

        public int numSearchSteps()

      • bestNodeAfterSearch

        public ISearchNode bestNodeAfterSearch()

      • setMaxSteps

        public void setMaxSteps(int maxSteps)

      • getNode

        private static ISearchNode getNode(PriorityQueue queue,
                  ISearchNode searchedNode)
        returns the element from a PriorityQueue of ISearchNodes
        Parameters:
        queue - queue to search in
        searchedNode - node we search
        Returns:
        node from the queue
